author: David Travis, Philip Hodgson

title: What We See When We Read
author: Peter Mendelsund
description: This is in the style of an experimental paperback. The illustrations are very clever and its nice to have around.

title: The Inevitable City
subTitle: The Resurgence of New Orleans and the Future of Urban America
author: Scott Cowen with Betsy Seifter
description: I went to school in New Orleans. The topic of designing a city and supporting its history is always a good read for me. In particular the generosity of New Orleans itself is shared in this read.

coverAlt: A simple color wheel showing red green bule and white

author: David Reinfurt

coverAlt: A greek or roman statue heading a soccer ball
title: What We Think About When We Think About Soccer
author: Simon Critchley
description: A super nerdy take on the sport and its history

coverAlt: A ladder built out of number 2 pencils
title: The Gift of Failure

author: Jessica Lahey

coverAlt: A diagram depicting a food pyramid and some other mythical and cultish figures
title: Everyday in Magic
author: Raybin and King
description: A birthday present from my good friend Sophie.

coverAlt: A colorful grid of type samples from various typefaces
title: New and Recent Typefaces by Hoefler & Co.
subTitle: Eleventh Edition
description: I am very fond of the Hoefler & Co. type capsule that I purchased to get Operator Mono.

title: Brooklyn Magazine
author: Various
description: Late in the pandemic I was buying masks at a dry cleaning place. There was this whole stack of Brooklyn Magazines that she was just willing to give me. Its very cool that the relaunch issue had about 4 different covers and I got all of them.
